meanings.definition: A person who persistently asks for something or makes requests in an insistent manner.
meanings.sent1: The importuners at the charity event kept asking for donations.
meanings.sent2: The importuners outside the store were asking for signatures on a petition.
meanings.sent3: The importuners at the party were like broken records, always asking for more snacks.
meanings.sent4: The importuners in the office were like buzzing mosquitoes, constantly seeking attention.
meanings.sent5: The image of the importuners begging for help stayed in my mind long after the event.

meanings.definition: To make persistent requests or demands.
meanings.sent1: She importuners her parents for a new toy every day.
meanings.sent2: The salesperson importuners customers to buy the latest products.
meanings.sent3: The child importuners the teacher for extra playtime every afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The politician importuners the public for support during the election campaign.
meanings.sent5: The persistent rain importuners the farmers, causing delays in harvesting.
